steps.title: Define the class
steps.description: We start by defining a User class. Classes in Python use the class keyword followed by the class name.

steps.title: Initialize with constructor
steps.description: The __init__ method is Python's constructor. It runs when you create a new User instance. We set up three attributes: name, email, and a default active status.

steps.title: Add a deactivate method
steps.description: This method changes the user's active status to False. Simple methods like this modify the object's state.

steps.title: Implement email functionality
steps.description: The send_email method checks if the user is active before sending. This demonstrates conditional logic within a class method.
